title: The Future of Digital Learning and Blended Instruction: Language Education Course for Adult Learners Aged 40+

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and beginner-level language learning experience
context.additional_context: Learners, as general citizens, aim to improve practical language skills necessary for work and daily life. Post-pandemic adaptation to digital learning environments varies, necessitating a phased approach.

learning_goals: Learners can perform communication skills (listening/speaking) with over 80% accuracy in a blended learning environment utilizing digital platforms (video conferencing tools, LMS).
Through interactions with peers and instructors on weekly online discussion boards, learners can generate ten or more sentences applying basic grammatical structures.
In offline workshops, learners can collaborate with team members using digital collaboration tools (e.g., Google Docs) to complete language projects (e.g., writing simple travel dialogues).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
